gantrytips.tip: Use the layout slider to select the desired column distribution (width) used for the Top Positions. The active value will be highlighted in blue and underlined. The Force Positionss attribute causes all the Top positions to be displayed. If there is no module published in a position, then a blank space is left. The position count controls the number of forced positions.

Use the layout slider to select the desired column distribution (width) used for the Navigation Positions. The active value will be highlighted in blue and underlined. The Force Positionss attribute causes all the Navigation positions to be displayed. If there is no module published in a position, then a blank space is left. The position count controls the number of forced positions.

Use the layout slider to select the desired column distribution (width) used for the Header Positions. The active value will be highlighted in blue and underlined. The Force Positionss attribute causes all the Header positions to be displayed. If there is no module published in a position, then a blank space is left. The position count controls the number of forced positions.

Use the layout slider to select the desired column distribution (width) used for the Showcase Positions. The active value will be highlighted in blue and underlined. The Force Positionss attribute causes all the Showcase positions to be displayed. If there is no module published in a position, then a blank space is left. The position count controls the number of forced positions.

Use the layout slider to select the desired column distribution (width) used for the Feature Positions. The active value will be highlighted in blue and underlined. The Force Positionss attribute causes all the Feature positions to be displayed. If there is no module published in a position, then a blank space is left. The position count controls the number of forced positions.

Use the layout slider to select the desired column distribution (width) used for the Utility Positions. The active value will be highlighted in blue and underlined. The Force Positionss attribute causes all the Utility positions to be displayed. If there is no module published in a position, then a blank space is left. The position count controls the number of forced positions.

Use the layout slider to select the desired column distribution (width) used for the MainTop Positions. The active value will be highlighted in blue and underlined. The Force Positionss attribute causes all the MainTop positions to be displayed. If there is no module published in a position, then a blank space is left. The position count controls the number of forced positions.

Use the layout slider to select the desired column distribution (width) used for the MainBody Positions. The active value will be highlighted in blue and underlined. You can also use the slider to decide on which side of the MainBody you would like to display the Sidebar Positionss.

Use the layout slider to select the desired column distribution (width) used for the MainBottom Positions. The active value will be highlighted in blue and underlined. The Force Positionss attribute causes all the MainBottom positions to be displayed. If there is no module published in a position, then a blank space is left. The position count controls the number of forced positions.

Use the layout slider to select the desired column distribution (width) used for the Extension Positions. The active value will be highlighted in blue and underlined. The Force Positionss attribute causes all the Extension positions to be displayed. If there is no module published in a position, then a blank space is left. The position count controls the number of forced positions.

Use the layout slider to select the desired column distribution (width) used for the Bottom Positions. The active value will be highlighted in blue and underlined. The Force Positionss attribute causes all the Bottom positions to be displayed. If there is no module published in a position, then a blank space is left. The position count controls the number of forced positions.

Use the layout slider to select the desired column distribution (width) used for the Footer Positions. The active value will be highlighted in blue and underlined. The Force Positionss attribute causes all the Footer positions to be displayed. If there is no module published in a position, then a blank space is left. The position count controls the number of forced positions.

Use the layout slider to select the desired column distribution (width) used for the Copyright Positions. The active value will be highlighted in blue and underlined. The Force Positionss attribute causes all the Footer positions to be displayed. If there is no module published in a position, then a blank space is left. The position count controls the number of forced positions.
